	document.title = 'Calendar of Events';
	
</script>	

        
                <script>
                    var sw = screen.width;
                    
					
					var iw = window.innerWidth;
                    
					
						var x = sw;
					
					if ((sw <800) || (iw <800))
                    // if (true)
                    {	
                    	// check for hash only if we're going to redirect.
                    	if(window.location.hash) 
						{
							var hash = window.location.hash.substring(1); //Puts hash in variable, and removes the pound character
						    // alert (hash);
						} 
						else 
						{
						  	var hash = '';
						  	// alert("no hash : " + hash);
						  	
						}

						/*var GoToUrl2 = 'http://www.eventkeeper.com/mars/xpages/B/BETHEL/ekp.cfm?#' + hash;*/
						
						var GoToUrl2 = 'http://www.eventkeeper.com/mars/xpages/B/BETHEL/ekp.cfm?#' + hash; 
						// location.href = 'http://www.eventkeeper.com/mars/xpages/B/BETHEL/ekp.cfm?';
                        location.href = GoToUrl2;
                        
                    }

            <script>

function makeArray0() 
{
    for (i = 0; i<makeArray0.arguments.length; i++)
        this[i] = makeArray0.arguments[i];
}

function DateBarFormat(dbWeekday,dbMon,dbDay,dbYear) 
{
    // document.write(jsLang + ' ');
	document.write(dow7[dbWeekday-1] + '  ');
    document.write(names[dbMon-1] + ' ');
    document.write(dbDay + ', ');
    document.write(dbYear);
}

var days      = new makeArray0(31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31);



	var jsLang = "EN";
	
	var names     = new makeArray0('January','February','March','April','May','June','July','August','September','October','November','December');

	var dow3       = new makeArray0('Sun','Mon','Tue','Wed','Thu','Fri','Sat');
	var dow       = new makeArray0('S','M','T','W','T','F','S');
	var dow7       = new makeArray0('Sunday','Monday','Tuesday','Wednesday','Thursday','Friday','Saturday');

function DateBarFormat(dbWeekday,dbMon,dbDay,dbYear) 
{
    // document.write(jsLang + ' ');
	document.write(dow7[dbWeekday-1] + '  ');
    document.write(names[dbMon-1] + ' ');
    document.write(dbDay + ', ');
    document.write(dbYear);
}

function BigWeekFormat(dbMon,dbDay,dbYear) 
{
    // document.write(jsLang + ' ');
    document.write(names[dbMon-1] + ' ');
    document.write(dbDay + ', ');
    document.write(dbYear);
}



</script>

<script>
// begin inc_ek_js.cfm


var xpage_ek_filename = "http://www.eventkeeper.com/mars/xpages/B/BETHEL/EK.cfm";
var jsAllArgs = "curOrg=BETHEL";


function OkToUseInnerHTML()
{
	// let's assume everybody supports this by now
	return true;
}

function ShowPassInfo(cOrg, passID)
{
	var url = "http://www.eventkeeper.com/code/popinfo.cfm?curOrg=" + cOrg + "&curApp=passes&pID=" + passID;
	window.open(url, "popnotewin", "width=400,height=400,left=100,top=100, resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes").focus();
}

function ShowRegForm(cOrg, dfdID)
{
	var url = "http://www.eventkeeper.com/code/ekform.cfm?curOrg=" + cOrg + "&curID=" + dfdID;
	window.open(url, "popnotewin", "width=800,height=800,left=100,top=80, resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes").focus();
}

function RealMonth(codeMonth)
{
	var humanMonthNumber = Number(codeMonth) + 1;
	return humanMonthNumber;
}	


var today = new Date();
var day = today.getDate(), month = today.getMonth(), year = y2k(today.getYear()), whichOne = 0;
var today2 = year + "-" + padout(month) + "-" + padout(day);

function y2k(number)    { return (number < 1000) ? number + 1900 : number; }

function padout(number) { return (number < 10) ? '0' + number : number; }

function tfDayHasEvent (thisDay, evtDayList)
{
	var rMonth = RealMonth(document.SearchCriteria.fMonth.value);
    var thisDate = "\'" + document.SearchCriteria.fYear.value + "-" + padout(rMonth) + "-" + padout(thisDay);
	var testdate = new RegExp (thisDate);
	// alert(evtDayList);
	// alert("inc_ek_js.cfm rmonth = " + rMonth);
	// alert("inc_ek_js.cfm testdate = " + testdate);
	// alert(testdate.test(evtDayList));
	
	return testdate.test(evtDayList);
}

/* 7/13/2017 */
/* need to modify selectDay so that it knows about pagination and keywords */
function selectDay( newMonth, newDay, newYear ) 
{
		
		
		document.SearchCriteria.fDay.value = newDay;
			
		var GoToURL = "";
		
		
			GoToURL += "http://www.eventkeeper.com/mars/xpages/B/BETHEL/EK.cfm?" + jsAllArgs + "&curMonth=" + RealMonth(newMonth);
			// GoToURL += "ek.cfm?" + jsAllArgs + "&curMonth=" + RealMonth(newMonth);
			
		
			GoToURL += "&curYear=" + newYear;
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		if (newDay!='0')
		{
		var GoToDate = "";
		GoToDate += RealMonth(newMonth) + "/";
		GoToDate += newDay + "/" + newYear;
		
		GoToURL += "&SelectedDate=" + GoToDate;
		
		// this next line was commented out : don't know why : be prepared to add it back
		GoToURL += "#" + GoToDate;
		}
		
		
		
		location.href = GoToURL;
		
		
		
}



function tfToday (thisDay)
{
    return (today2 == document.SearchCriteria.fYear.value + "-" + padout(document.SearchCriteria.fMonth.value) + "-" + padout(thisDay));
}

function changeYear(tfEvtListPg3) 
{
	// woof : might need to use Layers to avoid layers even in NN on bigMonth
	// sniff
    if (OkToUseInnerHTML()) 
		newYear = document.Cal.Year.options[document.Cal.Year.selectedIndex].value + '';
	else
		newYear = document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.Cal.Year.options[document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.Cal.Year.selectedIndex].value + '';

	document.SearchCriteria.fYear.value = newYear;
    ShowMonth (document.SearchCriteria.fMonth.value,newYear,tfEvtListPg3,'JS-CY-186');
}

function changeMonth(newMonth) 
{
	// alert("A: Change Montho");
	// sniff
    if (OkToUseInnerHTML()) 
	{
		// alert ("A: change month, IE, layers");		
		// alert("newMonth = doggie " + document.Cal.Month.options[document.Cal.Month.selectedIndex].value);
														 
		newMonth = document.Cal.Month.options[document.Cal.Month.selectedIndex].value + '';
	}
	else
	{
		alert("A: Second option");
		newMonth = document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.Cal.Month.options[document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.Cal.Month.selectedIndex].value + '';
	}
			
	window.document.SearchCriteria.fMonth.value = newMonth;
    // alert("existing year = " + document.SearchCriteria.fYear.value);
	ShowMonth (newMonth,document.SearchCriteria.fYear.value,true,'JS-CM-178');    
}

function IndexOfDayPicked (thisMonth, thisDay, thisYear)
{
	var someDateStr = RealMonth(thisMonth) + '/' + thisDay + '/' + thisYear;
	// alert("checking day = " + someDateStr);
	// alert("PickedDayArray = " + PickedDayArray + "PickedDayArray.length = " + PickedDayArray.length);
	
	/*
	for (var i = 0; i < PickedDayArray.length; i++) 
   	{ 
   		if (someDateStr == PickedDayArray[i])
		{
			return i ; 
	 	}
	}
	*/
	return -1;
}

function MakeCalendarCode(Month,Year,tfEvtListPg1) 
{
	var tfPickDates = false;
	
	// var nm = 5;
	
	
	
	// 
    var output = '';
    // 
    // opera fussing : remove form from here and put it on the page.
	// pre styles = output += '<table bgcolor="' + tbgColor1 + '" border=1>';
	output += '<table align="center" ID="scal_table_outer" >';
	// output += '<form name="Cal" style="margin-bottom: 0px;"><table bgcolor="' + tbgColor1 + '" border=1>';
	    
	// 
    if (tfEvtListPg1)
	{
		
		

		output += '<tr><td align=center width=100%><select name="Month" class="scal_month_list" onChange="changeMonth();">';

		// 
    	for (month=0; month<12; month++) 
		{
        	if (month == Month) 
				output += '<option value="' + month + '" selected>' + names[month] + '<\/option>';
        	else              
				output += '<option value="' + month + '">' + names[month] + '<\/option>';
    	}

    	output += '<\/select>&nbsp;<select name="Year" ID="WTF:259" class="scal_year_list" onChange="changeYear(1);">';

    	// 
		// BOYDEN asked...
		
		
				if (Year == 2013)
					output += '<option value="2013" selected>2013<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2013">2013<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2014)
					output += '<option value="2014" selected>2014<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2014">2014<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2015)
					output += '<option value="2015" selected>2015<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2015">2015<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2016)
					output += '<option value="2016" selected>2016<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2016">2016<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2017)
					output += '<option value="2017" selected>2017<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2017">2017<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2018)
					output += '<option value="2018" selected>2018<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2018">2018<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2019)
					output += '<option value="2019" selected>2019<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2019">2019<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2020)
					output += '<option value="2020" selected>2020<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2020">2020<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2021)
					output += '<option value="2021" selected>2021<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2021">2021<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2022)
					output += '<option value="2022" selected>2022<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2022">2022<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2023)
					output += '<option value="2023" selected>2023<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2023">2023<\/option>';
				
				if (Year == 2024)
					output += '<option value="2024" selected>2024<\/option>';
				else
					output += '<option value="2024">2024<\/option>';
				
		
    	output += '<\/select><\/td><\/tr>';
	}
	
	output += '<tr><td align=center colspan=2>';

 	// 

    firstDay = new Date(Year,Month,1);
    startDay = firstDay.getDay();

    if (((Year % 4 == 0) && (Year % 100 != 0)) || (Year % 400 == 0))
         days[1] = 29; 
    else
         days[1] = 28;

	// 
    output += '<table ID="scal_table_inner"><tr>';

	// 
    for (i=0; i<7; i++)
	{
        output += '<td class="scal_details_dow_row">';
		
		output += dow[i]; 
		
		output += '<\/td>';
	}
		
    output += '<\/tr><tr align=center valign=middle>';

    var column = 0;
    var lastMonth = Month - 1;
    if (lastMonth == -1) lastMonth = 11;

	// 
    for (i=0; i<startDay; i++, column++)
        output += '<td class="scal_details_gray_day">' + (days[lastMonth]-startDay+i+1) + '<\/td>';

	// 
	for (i=1; i<=days[Month]; i++, column++) 
	{
		{	output += '<td align=center valign=middle'; }
			
		// 
		if 	((tfPickDates) && (IndexOfDayPicked(Month, i, Year) != -1))
		{ 
			output +=  ' bgcolor=red';
		}
		// 
		else if (tfToday(i)) 
		{ 
			output +=  ' class="scal_details_today"';
		}

		else
		{ 
			output +=  ' class="scal_details_regular_day"';
		}

		output += '>';
		
		// 
		
		// alert("woofta : i = " + i + " daylist = " + daylist);
		
		if (tfDayHasEvent(i,daylist))
		// if (i > 15)
		{
			// alert("day has event");
			output += '<a href="javascript:selectDay(' + Month + ',' + i + ',' + Year + ')">';
			output += i;
			output += '<\/a>';
		}
		else
		{
			// alert("day does not have event");
			output += '' + i + '';
		}
		
        output += '<\/td>';
		
		if (column == 6) {
            output += '<\/tr><tr align=center valign=middle>';
            column = -1;
        }
    }

	// 
    if (column > 0) {
        for (i=1; column<7; i++, column++)
            output +=  '<td class="scal_details_gray_day">' + i + '<\/td>';
    }

	// 
    
	// output += '<\/tr><\/table><\/td><\/tr><\/table><\/form>\n';
	
	// opera fussing remove close form tag
	output += '<\/tr><\/table><\/td><\/tr><\/table>\n';
	
	
	
    return output;
}


function ShowMonth (aMonth, aYear, tfEvtListPg4, debugLocation)
{
	
	
	// alert("showmonth");
	document.SearchCriteria.fMonth.value = aMonth;
	document.SearchCriteria.fYear.value = aYear;
	
	// alert("fMonth = " + document.SearchCriteria.fMonth.value);
	
    var calCode = MakeCalendarCode( aMonth, aYear, tfEvtListPg4 );
    
	
// var calCode = MakeSimpleCalendarCode( aMonth, aYear );
	
	// have to have an extra char at the end of the calCode or Mac IE gets confused.
	// a space works - so does newline i.e. backslash n.
	
	var name="SMALL_CAL";
	var preCalCode = '<form name="Cal" style="margin-bottom: 0px;">';
	var postCalCode = '</form>';
		
	if (tfEvtListPg4)
	{
		// sniff
		if (document.getElementById) 
		{ 
			// alert("still using getElementByID");
			// document.getElementById("SMALL_CAL").innerHTML  = 'hello dog';
			var el = document.getElementById('SMALL_CAL')
			
			el.innerHTML  = 'loading...';
			
			// if (isMac) calCode = preCalCode + calCode + postCalCode;
			if (false) 
			{
				alert("isMac");
				calCode = preCalCode + calCode + postCalCode;
			}
			else
				// alert ("not mac");
				
			document.getElementById('SMALL_CAL').innerHTML  = calCode;
		} 
    	else if (document.layers) 
		{
			alert ("layers");
			
        	document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.open();
        	document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.write(preCalCode);
        	document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.write(calCode);
        	document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.write(postCalCode);
        	document.layers['SMALL_CAL'].document.close();
    	} 
		else 
		{
        	if (document.all) 
			{ 
				alert ("document.all");
				document.all.SMALL_CAL.innerHTML = calCode;
			} 
    	}
	}
	else
	{
		// Opera fussing
		// document.write("<form name='Cal' style='margin-bottom: 0px;'>");
		alert("iej.c : 454");
		document.write(calCode);
		// document.write("</form>");
	}
	
	// alert("ShowMonth END (mm/yyyy = "+ aMonth + "/" + aYear + ") IsEventList =" + tfEvtListPg4 + " Location = " + debugLocation + "."); 
	
	return;	
}


// reqMonth = 1

</script>

var newWin;
var openArgs = 'toolbars=no,addressbar=no,menubar=no,directories=no,scrollbars=yes,resizable=no';
function NewPop(theURL)
{
	newWin = window.open(theURL,openArgs);
	return false;
}
</script>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7435974"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:darkviolet">
            	Teen Discarded Book Craft with  Vanessa Fasanella
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/book-scrapbook.jpeg" style="height:208px; width:243px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:#000000"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Turn your favorite discarded book into a scrapbook, travel memento, or photo album. Cut, paint, and decorate, and add photo corners and headings, transforming a book into a personal work of art. Repurpose library discards, hardcovers that are age-appropriate fiction. <strong>This program is intended for teens in 6th-12th grade.</strong></span></span></span></p>

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Monday Night at the Movies!
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:00 PM - 7:45 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/11/what-happens-later-3411407868-e1699468835522.jpg" style="height:339px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Join us for this romantic comedy directed by and starring Meg Ryan!  <span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); color:rgb(34, 34, 34)">Two ex-lovers, Bill and Willa, get snowed in at a regional airport overnight. Indefinitely delayed, Willa, a magical thinker, and Bill, a catastrophic one, find themselves just as attracted to and annoyed by one another as they did decades earlier.  As they unpack the riddle of their mutual past and compare their lives to the dreams they once shared, they begin to wonder if their reunion is mere coincidence, or something more enchanted.</span></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); color:rgb(34, 34, 34)">This DVD is Rated R.</span></span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7317245"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Morning Book Chat
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    10:15 AM - 11:30 AM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/07/midnight-library-1953248225-e1689704043215.jpg" style="height:377px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This month's selection is <em>The Midnight Library</em> by Matt Haig.  Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever.  Every book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.  To see how things would be if you had made other choices. . . Would you have done anything different, if you had the chance to undo your regrets?   A fascinating novel about all the choices that go into a life well lived. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">HOW TO GET A COPY:  Please <a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20midnight%20library;qtype=keyword;fi%3Asearch_format=book;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BHaig%2C%20Matt%201975-%5D"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong><u>click here</u></strong></span></a><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20midnight%20library;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BHaig%2C%20Matt%201975-%5D"> </a>to make an online request with your Library card; or call us at <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>203-794-8756</strong> </span>to check availability of pre-ordered copies at the Circulation Desk.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">We are also offering a book guide for all registrants which highlights the authors background, offers book interviews and insights, as well as topics and questions to stimulate the conversation.</span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Registration is required for all Library events.</span></span></strong></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:green">
            	Ready, Set, Read!
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    4:15 PM - 4:45 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2022/08/fall-22-ready-set-read.png" style="height:250px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="background-color:transparent; color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial,sans-serif">Kids in </span><strong>Pre-K through 2nd grade</strong></span><span style="background-color:transparent; color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial,sans-serif; font-size:12pt"><span style="font-size:16px">,</span> it's adventure time! Buckle up as we dive into a thrilling story that'll spark your imagination, followed by an exciting craft that brings the tale to life, making learning as fun as it can be. </span><a href="https://www.bethellibrary.org/home/updates/activities/beanstack/1000-books-before-kindergarten/" style="text-decoration-line: none;"><span style="background-color:transparent; color:rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family:arial,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Don't forget to sign up for 1,000 Books Before Kindergarten!</span></a></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7427055"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Bethel Highways & Byways:  A History of the Town's Roads, Streets, Districts, and Forgotten Places
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/bethel-highways-byways-3229672954-e1701884010214.jpg" style="height:187px; width:300px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">We are very pleased to welcome back Town Historian Patrick Tierney Wild!  This event will focus on the origins of Bethel's oldest roads, the early development of its five distinct districts, and the local place names that have mostly been forgotten.  </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px">Our presenter, Patrick Tierney Wild, is a Bethel native who has served as the town's municipal historian since 1993.  He attended kindergarten at the Plumtrees one-room schoolhouse, St. Mary's School, Bethel High School, and has a BS degree from Rutgers University and an MA from the College of New Rochelle.  He has written articles for the Danbury News-Times, Bethel Home News, Bethel Beacon, and Bethel Grapevine, and provided historical information for biographical documentaries on P.T. Barnum for the Arts & Entertainment channel and the Discovery channel.  He is the author of Images of America-Bethel (1996), Historic Tales of Bethel (2001), and Bethel-Village Among the Hills (2023).  He served as a Bethel selectman from 2003-2007.  He taught for thirty-six years and retired in 2020.  His last position was as a social studies teacher at Ridgefield High School, where he taught Advanced Placement courses in United States History and United States Government and Politics.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</strong>  </span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px">Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/84597212505"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/84597212505</span></a></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Maria Parloa Community Room
                    </DIV>
                
                    <DIV class="event_registration">

								value="Register"

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>

                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7418833"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	12 Tips to Manage Anxiety
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/anxiety-copy-1-1857955125-e1701540466599.jpeg" style="height:106px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">When faced with anxiety, what can one do before and during to help reduce and relieve anxiety and regain balance, calm, and clarity?  Come learn about anxiety and what you can do to help prevent it and to manage it if it occurs.  Our popular presenter, Wendy Hurwitz, MD, states everyone will come away with information, tools, and techniques to help manage anxiety and help regain and restore balance and calm.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">A graduate of Yale University of Medicine, Dr. Wendy Hurwitz is a nationally recognized expert on stress.  A former medical researcher for ABC News, Dr. Hurwitz is an expert in two fields:  Mind/Body Medicine and Energy Medicine.  She has a forthcoming book on stress.  Dr. Hurwitz helps organizations and individuals achieve peak performance by enhancing vitality and wellness.  She translates the latest and most sophisticated scientific research into practical, easy-to-use techniques people can use to maintain and enhance vitality even under the most trying circumstances.  Dr. Hurwitz has provided training for AT&T, Unilever, Lowe Worldwide, the FDNY, and has been an invited guest speaker at the United Nations.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Out of respect for those with allergies, we request audience members to refrain from wearing perfume or cologne, if possible.  Thank you for your kind consideration.</span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend In Person or On Zoom.</span></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Here is the Zoom Link:<span style="color:#0000FF">  </span><a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/84734652463"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/84734652463</span></a></span></span></strong></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7405625"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Fairfield County Writers Group Write-In
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 4:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/01/ffcw-logo-2400616455-e1674065868745.jpg" style="height:164px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">The Fairfield County Writer’s Group, founded in 2011, has been supporting and helping writers in the county with regular write-ins and accelerated events during the Nanowrimo (National Novel Writing Month) season. The group is a non-profit and has no membership fees or dues. The community is made up of a variety of writers at different stages of their writing adventure. </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The Group has monthly write-ins, and the schedule is decided at the beginning of each month. Please click <a href="https://fairfieldcountywriters.org/event-calendar/"><u><strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)">here</span></strong></u></a> to see the FCWG Calendar for the latest schedule. <strong>Join us at our write-ins.</strong> These are designed to help motivate you to write more and be able to discuss writing issues with other writers. No registration is required.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">FCWG has a Facebook Group as well for discussion, celebration, and commiseration.</span></span></p>

                        </DIV>

								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults

                        <DIV class="event_description">

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7427447"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	New Year, New Career
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/new-year-new-career-2154522707-e1701794806413.png" style="height:166px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Join business specialist and career counselor Ellen Janpol (Bethel Library's Programming and Outreach Librarian) as she guides you through the job trends for career changers and job seekers in 2024.  Learn about the 5 major job search strategies that will improve your chances of success.  How will AI impact your search?  How to target your search to get the best possible result?  How to master the art of personal branding?  What resume changes will be best?  In this first of a two-part series (LinkedIn for Professionals is next), you will learn how to position yourself to get the best possible offer in 2024.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Before becoming the Programming and Outreach Librarian at Bethel Library, Ellen was the Business Librarian at the Westport Public Library and the Business Librarian at the New Haven Free Public Library.  In Westport, she facilitated a Job Search Work Team, where 90% of participants found new positions.  She has both a Master's in Library Science and an MBA.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a Zoom event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</strong></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/86421158505"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/86421158505</span></a></strong></span></span></p>

                        </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456478"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Seelye House
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7427771"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	LinkedIn For Professionals
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/linkedin-2101851041-e1701801027325.png" style="height:167px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">In this second of a two-part series on finding new jobs/careers in 2024, Don Wittman will discuss "LinkedIn for Professionals".  He will show how to leverage the power of this professional networking site to increase your online presence and personal brand.  He will help you develop a compelling headline and a well-crafted summary highlighting your skills and accomplishments.  The importance of keywords and their location in your profile will be emphasized.  This is a program well-worth your time.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Don Wittman, the 4-time #1 Best Selling author of books on LindkedIn is the head of Wittman Technology, LLC.  He is a prolific speaker, coach, and trainer on the LindedIn platform.  As a former CTO, he combines in-depth technical expertise toward the use of LinkedIn and a set  of processes to get people found.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</strong></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85369306135"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85369306135</span></a></strong></span></span></p>

This program is intended for </span><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>kids ages 4 and under.</strong></span><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial,sans-serif; font-size:12pt"><span style="font-size:16px"> </span>Join us for storytime every Monday through Saturday at 10:30 am!</span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7403733"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	CT Poetry Society
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><span style="font-size:16px"><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2021/05/adult-poetry-amd-e1622207017366.jpg" style="height:131px; width:200px" /></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Bethel Chapter of the CT Poetry Society offers its monthly poetry workshops to members and visitors on the 2nd Saturday of every month.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Each person brings an original poem to read aloud and receive feedback on. Poets at every level are invited to participate; you can be from any town in the area. Poems can be on any subject in any form. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Please register in advance and bring 6 copies of your poem. Our group is welcoming and congenial, emphasizing appreciation of each other's work combined with constructive suggestions   </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">For further information, contact Michael Garry, president, Bethel Chapter of CPS at mgarry1955@gmail.com.  </span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 4&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Morse
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456479"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  <a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="color: rgb(7, 130, 193);"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Seelye House
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7392460"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

                        <div class="text-right event_taf_rem">

                        		class="btn-advanced taf-btn" role="button" target="_blank">

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7418298"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	The Basics of Truffle Making
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2022/11/img_3915-1.jpg" style="height:333px; width:250px" /></p>

<div><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you simply love chocolate and cooking, or would like to learn to make some elegant desserts with chocolates, come to a workshop/demonstration entitled, "Basics of Chocolate Trufflemaking.  The talk will include some basic information about chocolate, the various types, and how to work with it.  Samples and recipes will include several different types of truffle candies, perfect for giving your loved ones on their special days.</span></span></div>

<div> </div>

<div><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Maria Brandriff, the presenter, was the former Assistant Director of the Cheshire Public Library, where she was in charge of public programming.  Mds. Brandrif's interest in fine cooking and baking came from growing up in a Ukrainian household where Viennnese-inspired tortes and confections dominated every holiday.  Since then, Ms. Brandriff has experimented with the traditional recipes and has come up with own variations.  At holiday time, she produces hundreds of chocolate truffle candies, which she shares with family and friends.   Mrs. Brandriff completed the Certificate of Gastronomy program at the University of New Haven and she has had the opportunity to travel to the city of Arles in France for an intensive 3 day apprenticeship with a noted Provencal chocolatier.  Ms. Brandriff has also been the featured chef at the Chef's Table series at Zinc Restaurant in New Haven.</span></span></div>

<div> </div>

<div><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.  A valid email is required for the Zoom link.</span></span></div>

<div> </div>

<div><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">In person attendance is limited to 15 attendees.</span></span></strong></div>

<div> </div>

<div><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Here is the Zoom Link:  </span></span></strong><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/86057705638"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/86057705638</span></a></span></span></strong></div>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7440932"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Monday Night Classics Book Group
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:45 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/curiosity-shop-3274137651-e1702998808139.jpg" style="height:361px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); font-size:16px">This month's selection is<em> The Old Curiosity Shop</em> by Charles Dickens.  This novel is a Victorian melodrama, as heartfelt and moving today as when it was first published in 1841.  </span><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); color:rgb(30, 25, 21); font-size:16px">Little Nell Trent lives in the quiet gloom of the old curiosity shop with her ailing grandfather, for whom she cares with selfless devotion.  But when they are unable to pay their debts to the stunted, lecherous and demonic money-lender Daniel Quilp, the shop is seized and they are forced to flee, thrown into a shadowy world in which there seems to be no safe haven.  Dickens's portrayal of the innocent, tragic Nell made </span></span><span style="font-size:16px"><em>The Old Curiosity Shop</em></span><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); color:rgb(30, 25, 21); font-size:16px"> an instant bestseller that captured the hearts of the nation, even as it was criticised for its sentimentality by figures such as Oscar Wilde.  Yet alongside the story's pathos are some of Dickens's greatest comic and grotesque creations: the ne'er-do-well Dick Swiveller, the mannish lawyer Sally Brass, the half-starved 'Marchioness' and the lustful, loathsome Quilp himself.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="color:#000000">HOW TO GET A COPY: Please</span> <strong><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20old%20curiosity%20shop;qtype=keyword;fi%3Asearch_format=book;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BDickens%2C%20Charles%201812-1870%5D"><span style="color:#0000FF">click here</span></a></strong> <span style="color:#000000">to make an online request with your Library card; or call us at</span> <strong><span style="color:#0000FF">203-794-8756 </span></strong> t<span style="color:#000000">o check availability of pre-ordered copies at the Circulation Desk.</span></span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Seelye House

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456480"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">

                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7422838"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Historical Fiction Book Club
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=in%20the%20heart%20of%20the%20sea;qtype=keyword;fi%3Asearch_format=book;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BPhilbrick%2C%20Nathaniel%5D" /><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/11/circe-2061718404-e1701273821803.jpg" style="height:387px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Travel through time and space with Historical Fiction!  Every other month, we'll discuss a book set in a different time period.  Whether you couldn't put it down or couldn't finish it, let's talk about it.  This month's selection is</span><em><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"> Circe </span></span></em><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">by Madeline Miller</span></span><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">.  In the house of Helios, god of the sun and the mightiest of the Titans, a daughter is born.  But Circe has neither the look or the voice of divinity, and is scorned and rejected by her kin.  Increasingly isolated, she turns to mortals for companionship, leading her to discover a power forbidden to the gods:  witchcraft.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">When love drives Circe to cast a dark spell, wrathful Zeus banishes her to the remote island of Aiaia.  There she learns to harness her occult craft, drawing strength from nature.  But she will not always be alone; many are destined to pass through Circe's place of exile, entwining their fates with hers.  The messenger god, Hermes.  The craftsman Daedalus.  A ship bearing a golden fleece.  And wily Odysseus, on his epic voyage home.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">There is danger for a solitary woman in this world, and Circe's independence draws the wrath of men and gods alike.  To protect what she holds dear, Circe must decide whether she belongs with the deities she is born from, or the mortals she has come to love.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">HOW TO GET A COPY:  Please</span><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"><strong> </strong></span><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=circe;qtype=keyword;fi%3Asearch_format=book;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BMiller%2C%20Madeline%5D" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:#0000FF"><strong><u>click here</u></strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to make an online request with your Library card; or call us at </span><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"><strong>203-794-8756</strong></span><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to check availability of pre-ordered copies at the Circulation Desk.</span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Morse
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7427949"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Genealogy:  The Basics
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/03/untitled-design-81-658946333-e1679427823100.png" style="height:281px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This talk will discuss the basics of genealogy by answering various questions, such as:  what is genealogy; how to start; where to get the information; why do it; who are your ancestors; and problems and dead ends.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The presenter, Sharon Maccaskie, has been a member of the D.A.R. (Daughters of the American Revolution) for over 35 years.  She helps people trace their family to patriots of the Revolutionary War.  She started researching her dad's family history during a high school class at the Library, and, as she says, "I was hooked".  </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</strong></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82984600292"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82984600292</span></a></strong></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7405626"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Fairfield County Writers Group Write-In
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 4:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/01/ffcw-logo-2400616455-e1674065868745.jpg" style="height:164px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">The Fairfield County Writer’s Group, founded in 2011, has been supporting and helping writers in the county with regular write-ins and accelerated events during the Nanowrimo (National Novel Writing Month) season. The group is a non-profit and has no membership fees or dues. The community is made up of a variety of writers at different stages of their writing adventure. </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The Group has monthly write-ins, and the schedule is decided at the beginning of each month. Please click <a href="https://fairfieldcountywriters.org/event-calendar/"><u><strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)">here</span></strong></u></a> to see the FCWG Calendar for the latest schedule. <strong>Join us at our write-ins.</strong> These are designed to help motivate you to write more and be able to discuss writing issues with other writers. No registration is required.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">FCWG has a Facebook Group as well for discussion, celebration, and commiseration.</span></span></p>

                        </DIV>

                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment. </strong> Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>

                        </DIV>

                <DIV class="event_time">

                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">

This program is intended for </span><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>children in grades 3rd-5th.</strong></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7461264"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Invasive Plants in Connecticut:  History and Action
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81245449108" /><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2024/01/untitled-design-3-3695189742-e1705164802597.png" style="height:188px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Join us at Bethel Library for a discussion of invasive plants in Connecticut.  These plants have come from far and wide and established themselves as residents in our fields and forests.  Unfortunately, they do not always make the best neighbors for our established flora.  In this talk, we will discuss the general role of invasive plants, highlighting some particular species of interest, and cover some strategies that you as a home owner or property stewart can use for their management.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Presenter J. D. Hill is a Bethel resident and board member of the Bethel Land Trust.  A computational biologist by trade, he is an avid nature lover, gardener, and scientific communicator.  He has given previous talks and workshops here at Bethel Library, ranging from beer brewing and kombucha making to winter sowing native plants.</span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</span></span></strong></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Here is the Zoom link: </strong> <strong><a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81245449108"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81245449108</span></a></strong></span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Maria Parloa Community Room
                    </DIV>
                
                    <!-- DIV class="event_taf_rem">

                    </DIV -->

            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">

                        <DIV class="event_description">
