        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456482"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7392464"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7427280"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Container Garden Tips, Tricks, and Trends
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/1-2212294583-e1701791866703.png" style="height:167px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><strong>The Annual Gardening Series, sponsored by the Bethel Garden Club, begins tonight!</strong></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Learn how to create a portable garden! Containers are a fast, affordable, flexible solution to growing flowers,<br />
vegetables, and herbs. Discover new container materials, design “recipes” for multi-season interest, tips on how many<br />
plants will fit, and how to keep designs looking gorgeous year-round.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Presenter Michele MacKinnon is a lively, trusted garden expert with a “growing" following. Her talks and articles reflect<br />
her unceasing focus on continuous learning, experimentation, and careful observation of plant and wildlife behaviors in<br />
her own garden. Michele studied landscape design at New York Botanical Garden and Berkshire Botanical Garden. She is<br />
a UCONN-certified Advanced Master Gardener, a CT NOFA (Northeast Organic Farming Association) Accredited Organic<br />
Land Care Professional, and a member of the Sherman Conservation Commission. Michele lives and gardens in a<br />
pollinator-friendly setting in Sherman, CT.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</strong> </span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Here is the Zoom link:   <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82100017089"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82100017089</span></a></span></span></strong></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7346517"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Did a Connecticut Woman Kill Jack the Ripper?
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/08/untitled-design-2-2873568888-e1692726709376.png" style="height:166px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Florence Maybrick was convicted of murdering her husband in England in the 1800's and sentenced to be hanged. Some historians believe that her husband was Jack the Ripper. Still others say the Florence was framed. In any case, this once infamous figure lived the last years of her life in obscruity in the Gaylordsville section of New Milford under an assumed name. Only a handful of people knew her real identity at the time. What's the truth behind all of this? Come and hear what we know, and what we don't know.  Thursday, August 31 marked exactly 135 years since the first of the Ripper's five grisly murders occurred.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Mike Allen, host of the podcast "Amazing Tales From Off and On Connecticut's Beaten Path" previously presented at Bethel Public Library on P. T. Barnum. His podcast is rated among the top 5 to 10% of all podcasts in the United States. Prior to that, Mike was the on-air radio News Director at i-95 FM (WRKI-FM) and its sister station 940 WINE AM, before becoming Press Secretary for the Mayor of Danbury. During a subsequent 25-year corporate career, he worked, lived, and traveled internationally, specializing in public speaking, communications, and marketing before retiring. He's lived in Connecticut for more than 50 years and currently resides in Danbury.</span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</span></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This is the Zoom Link for the event:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82911240445"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82911240445</span></a></span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Maria Parloa Community Room
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7403734"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	CT Poetry Society
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><span style="font-size:16px"><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2021/05/adult-poetry-amd-e1622207017366.jpg" style="height:131px; width:200px" /></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Bethel Chapter of the CT Poetry Society offers its monthly poetry workshops to members and visitors on the 2nd Saturday of every month.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Each person brings an original poem to read aloud and receive feedback on. Poets at every level are invited to participate; you can be from any town in the area. Poems can be on any subject in any form. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Please register in advance and bring 6 copies of your poem. Our group is welcoming and congenial, emphasizing appreciation of each other's work combined with constructive suggestions   </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">For further information, contact Michael Garry, president, Bethel Chapter of CPS at mgarry1955@gmail.com.  </span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456483"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment. </strong> Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Seelye House
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7392465"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

            <img src='https://www.eventkeeper.com/ek_icons/misc_none.png' 
		width='32' height='32'  
		alt='misc_none.png'>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7427290"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Cool Flowers:  Annuals For Earlier Color
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/cool-flowers-4282301661-e1701792126293.png" style="height:167px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><strong>The Annual Gardening Series, sponsored by the Bethel Garden Club, continues tonight!</strong></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Learn how to grow flowers that bloom weeks or even months before other plants start to bloom! Cool season annuals<br />
prefer colder growing conditions, and most can be started prior to the last frost, as soon as the ground can be worked.<br />
Cool flowers are productive, easy to grow, and will reward you with early spring and summer blooms.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Presenter Julia Cencebaugh Kloth is a popular speaker who explores the themes of creativity and gardening in harmony<br />
with nature. She works professionally in garden preservation for the Garden Conservancy, and previously with the<br />
University of Connecticut as a plant specialist. Julia holds certification from the New York Botanic Gardens in landscape<br />
design and the International Society of Arboriculture, and is a Master Gardener. She designs public and private gardens<br />
with an emphasis on environmental stewardship as exemplified in her own gardens at Old Barlow’s Carriage House in<br />
Ridgefield.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</strong> </span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/84895390327"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/84895390327</span></a></span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Maria Parloa Community Room
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7433753"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Nonfiction Book Club
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/innovators_-2582546281-e1702327466391.jpg" style="height:381px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Join us for our New Nonfiction Book Club!</strong></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This month's selection is <em>The Innovators:  How a Group of Hackers, Geniuses, and Geeks Created the Digital Revolution </em>by Walter Isaacson.  This is a story that is riveting, propulsive, and at times a deeply moving account of the people who created the computer and the Internet.  The tale of their teamwork is important because we don't often focus on how central that skills is to innovation.  This discussion is led by Programming and Outreach Librarian Ellen Janpol, who will talk about her time working for on of the "grandfathers of the Internet", Paul Baran!</span></span></p>

<p><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">HOW TO GET A COPY:  Please </span><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20innovators;qtype=keyword;fi%3Asearch_format=book;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BIsaacson%2C%20Walter%5D#facets" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong><u>click here</u></strong></span></a><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20midnight%20library;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BHaig%2C%20Matt%201975-%5D" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"> </a><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">to make an online request with your Library card; or call us at </span><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); color:rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"><strong>203-794-8756</strong> </span><span style="background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">to check availability of pre-ordered copies at the Circulation Desk.</span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7317261"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Morning Book Chat
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    10:15 AM - 11:30 AM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/07/the-paris-apartment-751004300-e1689704778856.jpg" style="height:380px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This month's selection is <em>The Paris Apartment</em> by Lucy Foley.  Jen needs a fresh start and goes to stay with her brother in Paris.  But her brother is missing, and the longer he stays missing, the more Jen digs into his situations, and the more questions she has.  His neighbors are an eclectic bunch, and not very friendly.  Everyone’s a neighbor.  Everyone’s a suspect.  And everyone knows something they’re not telling.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">HOW TO GET A COPY:  Please <a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20paris%20apartment;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;long_facet=authorpersonal;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BFoley%2C%20Lucy%20%28Novelist%29%5D"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong><u>click here</u></strong></span></a><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20midnight%20library;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BHaig%2C%20Matt%201975-%5D"> </a>to make an online request with your Library card; or call us at <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>203-794-8756</strong> </span>to check availability of pre-ordered copies at the Circulation Desk.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">We are also offering a book guide for all registrants which highlights the authors background, offers book interviews and insights, as well as topics and questions to stimulate the conversation.</span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7392453"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Knitting and Crocheting 
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    11:00 AM - 12:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADaFwbndiE/1/thumbnail_large-1.jpg" style="height:133px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Join us for a knit and crochet get together.  Work on your own project or help us make items for local charities.  If you know how to knit and/or crochet but are stuck on a project or technique, or if you are just looking for someone to craft with, this is the group for you.</span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">No registration required.</span></span></strong></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456484"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Seelye House
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7392466"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7427301"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	All About Composting
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/4-4088798008-e1701791757197.png" style="height:170px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><strong>The Annual Gardening Series, sponsored by the Bethel Garden Club, concludes tonight!</strong></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Understand what compost is and why it is referred to as “black gold.” Though compost can help revive your soil, it can<br />
sometimes be too much! Discover the various ways to compost, and how some produce more potent soil amendments<br />
for your plants than others.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Presenter Mary Hogue is a graduate of the famous Maine Compost School. She is a UConn Master Composter and<br />
Master Gardener, CT Audubon Master Naturalist, Chair of the Fairfield Forestry Committee, and Director of the<br />
Pollinator Pathway Team. Mary is a dedicated conservationist whose knowledge of the importance of soil health always<br />
inspires and informs audiences.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.</strong> </span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81782630105"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81782630105</span></a></span></span></strong></p>

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Scams and More Scams:  An Expert's Tips on How to Avoid Them
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/scam-1572528660-e1701729695560.png" style="height:168px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">One thing we have noticed during the last year is the number of scams-financial, computer, etc.-have picked up noticeably.  A Bethel Police Department Detective will discuss the most common scams affecting people and how we can identify them; how to protect ourselves from them; and how to report them.</span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7405627"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Fairfield County Writers Group Write-In
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 4:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/01/ffcw-logo-2400616455-e1674065868745.jpg" style="height:164px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">The Fairfield County Writer’s Group, founded in 2011, has been supporting and helping writers in the county with regular write-ins and accelerated events during the Nanowrimo (National Novel Writing Month) season. The group is a non-profit and has no membership fees or dues. The community is made up of a variety of writers at different stages of their writing adventure. </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The Group has monthly write-ins, and the schedule is decided at the beginning of each month. Please click <a href="https://fairfieldcountywriters.org/event-calendar/"><u><strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)">here</span></strong></u></a> to see the FCWG Calendar for the latest schedule. <strong>Join us at our write-ins.</strong> These are designed to help motivate you to write more and be able to discuss writing issues with other writers. No registration is required.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">FCWG has a Facebook Group as well for discussion, celebration, and commiseration.</span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456485"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">

                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7440112"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Social Security Strategies and Your Retirement Future
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:00 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/social-security-retirement-1428524163-e1702932161463.png" style="height:167px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Choosing when to elect your Social Security benefits can be one of the most important decisions as you approach retirement.  During this educational workshop, you will learn the influence of timing strategies on tax liability and overall benefit values.  We will discuss spousal benefits, as well as widow, divorced and single claiming concepts.  Additionally, we will illustrate how implementing social security timing in the context of your retirement planning is paramount in creating a successful retirement plan.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Mike Alimo, our presenter, is an Investment Advisor and President of USA Financial and Tax Services.  He has spent the last 18 years devoted to serving clientele in CT and New England.  He focuses on retirement planning and risk management, as well as comprehensive financial planning.  He remains committed to giving back to the community via informational presentations and educational workshops.  </span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.  </span></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/87679531285"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/87679531285 </span></a></span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

                        LOCATION: Maria Parloa Community Room
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456486"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Seelye House
                    </DIV>

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7457509"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Natural Solutions To Improving Sleep and Energy
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 2:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2024/01/untitled-design-2-2873568888-e1704829599765.png" style="height:166px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Dr. Edward Markowitz will discuss factors that worsen your sleep and energy problems, and offer natural solutions to improve your sleep and overall health.  Factors discussed will include:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Stress</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Hormone related problems</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Specific dietary factors</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Certain medications</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Poor sleep environment</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Dr. Edward Markowitz is the Clinical Director of Advanced Wellness and Injury Center.  He is a certified Wellness Consultant by the Foundation for Wellness Professionals, a diplomat in Occupational Health Care, and certified as a Functional Medicine Practitioner.  Dr. Markowitz has been in active practice for over 37 years and has helped over 10,000 patients using his unique combination of Nutritional Lifestyle Management, Accupuncture and Physical Medicine.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom. </strong></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Here is the Zoom link: <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81948688204"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81948688204</span></a></strong></span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Introduction to Cricut
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    2:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/07/image0-2.jpeg" style="height:188px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This class will introduce the basics of Cricut functions.  With Cricut, you can design and cut an array of material, from paper and fabric to vinyl and leather, and everything in between.  Its intuitive software allows you to effortlessly bring your visions to life, whether you're embellishing clothing, making intricate paper crafts, or adding a personal touch to home decor.</span></span></p>

            <img src='https://www.eventkeeper.com/ek_icons/misc_none.png' 
		width='32' height='32'  
		alt='misc_none.png'>
        </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7456487"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	AARP Foundation Tax-Aide
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    9:45 AM - 1:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2019/10/logo-tax-aide-logo.png" style="height:140px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Bethel Library is pleased to announce that AARP Foundation Tax-Aide will be returning this year to prepare tax returns, in person, for anyone, free of charge.  However, we would like to emphasize that AARP Tax-Aide focuses on taxpayers who are over 50 and have low to moderate income.  The Bethel Library is very convenient for Bethel taxpayers and we encourage taxpayers from other towns to look for AARP Tax-Aide or VITA sites near them before making an appointment at the Bethel Library.  </span><a href="https://www.irs.gov/individuals/free-tax-return-preparation-for-qualifying-taxpayers" style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>Click Here</strong></span></a><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> to find Tax-Aide and VITA services for taxpayers outside of the Bethel area, or call 800-906-9887 for VITA or 888-227-7669 for AARP Tax-Aide.  Please note that VITA does have limits on income whereas AARP Tax-Aide does not.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Please note that AARP Tax-Aide cannot prepare certain tax returns.  We don't want you to be disappointed when you show up for your appointment, so here are <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0)">the returns that the Tax-Aide volunteers <strong>cannot</strong> prepare:  </span></span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Connecticut resident for only part of the year</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Income from trading virtual currency</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Rental income, unless it is for less than 15 days</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Complicated capital gains, such as options or futures</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Self-employed taxpayers who have employees, expenses greater than $35,000, business use of the house, or other complicated factors</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Appointments for a specific time slot are required </strong>and can be made by registering below, calling 203-794-8756, ext. 3, or by coming to the Reference Desk on the second floor.  After you make your appointment, <strong>stop at the Circulation Desk to pick up a tax packet that you will need to complete before the day of your appointment and bring with you to your appointment.</strong>  Please also bring the following information with you:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Last year's tax return</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Social Security cards</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Government issued identification</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Your completed Intake/Interview Form (Form 13614-C)</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">All documentation for the income you received, for example W-2's, 1099's, Social Security statments, etc.</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">If you itemize your deductions, documents summarizing those deductions, such as property taxes paid, medical expenses, etc.</span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">​</span></span><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">You will be required to stay in the building while your taxes are being prepared.</span></span></strong></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Seelye House
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7449408"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

                        </DIV>

								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 &nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7417104"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	CT Poetry Society
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><span style="font-size:16px"><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2021/05/adult-poetry-amd-e1622207017366.jpg" style="height:131px; width:200px" /></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Bethel Chapter of the CT Poetry Society offers its monthly poetry workshops to members and visitors on the 2nd Saturday of every month.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Each person brings an original poem to read aloud and receive feedback on. Poets at every level are invited to participate; you can be from any town in the area. Poems can be on any subject in any form. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Please register in advance and bring 6 copies of your poem. Our group is welcoming and congenial, emphasizing appreciation of each other's work combined with constructive suggestions   </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">For further information, contact Michael Garry, president, Bethel Chapter of CPS at mgarry1955@gmail.com.  </span></span></p>

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Introduction to Cricut
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:30 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/07/image0-2.jpeg" style="height:188px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">This class will introduce the basics of Cricut functions.  With Cricut, you can design and cut an array of material, from paper and fabric to vinyl and leather, and everything in between.  Its intuitive software allows you to effortlessly bring your visions to life, whether you're embellishing clothing, making intricate paper crafts, or adding a personal touch to home decor.</span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>

                        LOCATION: Project Lab
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7449410"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

                        </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7405635"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Fairfield County Writers Group Write-In
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 4:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/01/ffcw-logo-2400616455-e1674065868745.jpg" style="height:164px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">The Fairfield County Writer’s Group, founded in 2011, has been supporting and helping writers in the county with regular write-ins and accelerated events during the Nanowrimo (National Novel Writing Month) season. The group is a non-profit and has no membership fees or dues. The community is made up of a variety of writers at different stages of their writing adventure. </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The Group has monthly write-ins, and the schedule is decided at the beginning of each month. Please click <a href="https://fairfieldcountywriters.org/event-calendar/"><u><strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)">here</span></strong></u></a> to see the FCWG Calendar for the latest schedule. <strong>Join us at our write-ins.</strong> These are designed to help motivate you to write more and be able to discuss writing issues with other writers. No registration is required.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">FCWG has a Facebook Group as well for discussion, celebration, and commiseration.</span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 &nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
