        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7457428"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Reverse Your Type 2 Diabetes:  Natural Solutions to Becoming Clinically Non-Diabetic
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 2:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2024/01/untitled-design-1-1-157000453-e1704828376421.png" style="height:168px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Dr. Edward Markowitz will discuss Type 2 Diabetes, and how to reverse it using natural solutions.  Topics discussed will include:</span></span></p>

<ul>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The top 3 reasons diabetics get worse with time</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">A unique clinical approach that allows the diabetes to reverse</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Is your treatment causing you to get worse over time?</span></span></li>
	<li><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Common drugs that may cause you to actually get worse </span></span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Dr. Edward Markowitz is the Clinical Director of Advanced Wellness and Injury Center.  He is a certified Wellness Consultant by the Foundation for Wellness Professionals, a diplomat in Occupational Health Care, and certified as a Functional Medicine Practitioner.  Dr. Markowitz has been in active practice for over 37 years and has helped over 10,000 patients using his unique combination of Nutritional Lifestyle Management, Accupuncture and Physical Medicine.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom. </strong></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong>Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85031069317"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85031069317</span></a></strong></span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>

                        LOCATION: Maria Parloa Community Room
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7417105"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	CT Poetry Society
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><span style="font-size:16px"><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2021/05/adult-poetry-amd-e1622207017366.jpg" style="height:131px; width:200px" /></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Bethel Chapter of the CT Poetry Society offers its monthly poetry workshops to members and visitors on the 2nd Saturday of every month.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Each person brings an original poem to read aloud and receive feedback on. Poets at every level are invited to participate; you can be from any town in the area. Poems can be on any subject in any form. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Please register in advance and bring 6 copies of your poem. Our group is welcoming and congenial, emphasizing appreciation of each other's work combined with constructive suggestions   </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">For further information, contact Michael Garry, president, Bethel Chapter of CPS at mgarry1955@gmail.com.  </span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7449413"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7317280"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Morning Book Chat
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    10:15 AM - 11:30 AM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/07/hello-beautiful.jpg" style="height:380px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">This month's selection is </span><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><em>Hello, Beautiful</em></span></span><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> by Ann Napolitano.  An emotionally layered and engrossing story of a family that asks: Can love make a broken person whole?  William Waters grew up in a house silenced by tragedy, where his parents could hardly bear to look at him, much less love him.  He meets Julia, who is inseparable from her three younger sisters.  But then darkness from William’s past surfaces, jeopardizing not only Julia’s carefully orchestrated plans for their future, but the sisters’ unshakeable loyalty to one another. The result is a catastrophic family rift that changes their lives for generations.  </span><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">Will the loyalty that once rooted them be strong enough to draw them back together when it matters most?</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">HOW TO GET A COPY:  Please <a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=hello%20beautiful;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;long_facet=authorpersonal;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BNapolitano%2C%20Ann%5D"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong><u>click here</u></strong></span></a><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20midnight%20library;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BHaig%2C%20Matt%201975-%5D"> </a>to make an online request with your Library card; or call us at <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>203-794-8756</strong> </span>to check availability of pre-ordered copies at the Circulation Desk.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">We are also offering a book guide for all registrants which highlights the authors background, offers book interviews and insights, as well as topics and questions to stimulate the conversation.</span></span></p>

                        </DIV>

                	Thursday May 23, 2024
                
                  
            </DIV>
            
        <DIV class="event_icon">
            <img src='https://www.eventkeeper.com/ek_icons/misc_none.png' 
		width='32' height='32'  
		alt='misc_none.png'>
        </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7440125"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Building a Lasting Legacy:  Essential Estate and Tax Planning Strategies for Retirement
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    6:00 PM - 7:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/12/estate-planning-1122939722-e1702932527123.png" style="height:260px; width:300px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">It can be easy to overlook, but an estate plan is essential for nearly every person, regardless of how much money you have.  Without a plan, the laws in your state can govern what happens to your assets, leaving your family to deal with lengthy probate court delays and diffucult decisions.  In this course, we will share with you tax strategies and concepts, as well as examples and case studies to help illustrate how you can potentially protect your hard-earned resources for the next generation.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Mike Alimo, our presenter, is an Investment Advisor and President of USA Financial and Tax Services.  He has spent the last 18 years devoted to serving clientele in CT and New England.  He focuses on retirement planning and risk management, as well as comprehensive financial planning.  He remains committed to giving back to the community via informational presentations and educational workshops.  </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong><span style="font-size:16px">This is a hybrid event; you can choose to attend in person or on Zoom.  </span></strong></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><strong><span style="font-size:16px">Here is the Zoom link:  <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/j/88428240122"><span style="color:#0000FF">https://us02web.zoom.us/j/88428240122</span></a></span></strong></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756, ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Maria Parloa Community Room
                    </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7405636"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Fairfield County Writers Group Write-In
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 4:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/01/ffcw-logo-2400616455-e1674065868745.jpg" style="height:164px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">The Fairfield County Writer’s Group, founded in 2011, has been supporting and helping writers in the county with regular write-ins and accelerated events during the Nanowrimo (National Novel Writing Month) season. The group is a non-profit and has no membership fees or dues. The community is made up of a variety of writers at different stages of their writing adventure. </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The Group has monthly write-ins, and the schedule is decided at the beginning of each month. Please click <a href="https://fairfieldcountywriters.org/event-calendar/"><u><strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)">here</span></strong></u></a> to see the FCWG Calendar for the latest schedule. <strong>Join us at our write-ins.</strong> These are designed to help motivate you to write more and be able to discuss writing issues with other writers. No registration is required.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">FCWG has a Facebook Group as well for discussion, celebration, and commiseration.</span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7449415"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 &nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7417106"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	CT Poetry Society
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><span style="font-size:16px"><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2021/05/adult-poetry-amd-e1622207017366.jpg" style="height:131px; width:200px" /></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Bethel Chapter of the CT Poetry Society offers its monthly poetry workshops to members and visitors on the 2nd Saturday of every month.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Each person brings an original poem to read aloud and receive feedback on. Poets at every level are invited to participate; you can be from any town in the area. Poems can be on any subject in any form. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Please register in advance and bring 6 copies of your poem. Our group is welcoming and congenial, emphasizing appreciation of each other's work combined with constructive suggestions   </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">For further information, contact Michael Garry, president, Bethel Chapter of CPS at mgarry1955@gmail.com.  </span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 4&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>

                        LOCATION: Morse

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7449404"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Knitting and Crocheting 
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    11:00 AM - 12:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADaFwbndiE/1/thumbnail_large-1.jpg" style="height:133px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Join us for a knit and crochet get together.  Work on your own project or help us make items for local charities.  If you know how to knit and/or crochet but are stuck on a project or technique, or if you are just looking for someone to craft with, this is the group for you.</span></span></p>

<p><strong><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">No registration required.</span></span></strong></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7449417"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7405637"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Fairfield County Writers Group Write-In
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 4:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/01/ffcw-logo-2400616455-e1674065868745.jpg" style="height:164px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">The Fairfield County Writer’s Group, founded in 2011, has been supporting and helping writers in the county with regular write-ins and accelerated events during the Nanowrimo (National Novel Writing Month) season. The group is a non-profit and has no membership fees or dues. The community is made up of a variety of writers at different stages of their writing adventure. </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">The Group has monthly write-ins, and the schedule is decided at the beginning of each month. Please click <a href="https://fairfieldcountywriters.org/event-calendar/"><u><strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)">here</span></strong></u></a> to see the FCWG Calendar for the latest schedule. <strong>Join us at our write-ins.</strong> These are designed to help motivate you to write more and be able to discuss writing issues with other writers. No registration is required.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">FCWG has a Facebook Group as well for discussion, celebration, and commiseration.</span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>

                        LOCATION: Morse

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7449419"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	 Mindfulness Meditation for Adults
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://media-public.canva.com/MADesfWLo78/1/thumbnail_large.jpg" style="height:143px; width:200px" /></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">If you are struggling with stress, an over-active mind and want to find a new perspective on how mindfulness and meditation can help in navigating the challenges of your everyday life,</span><strong> </strong><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:arial; font-size:16px">then join Prabha Makayee as she guides you through the steps of meditation.  See what you can accomplish by taking responsibility over what kinds of thoughts you think.  With just one second, one breath and one thought of changing your perspective you can realign your well-being to a more peaceful, happy mindset. </span><span style="color:rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">  </span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>No registration required.</strong></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 &nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7417107"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	CT Poetry Society
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    1:00 PM - 3:00 PM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><span style="font-size:16px"><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2021/05/adult-poetry-amd-e1622207017366.jpg" style="height:131px; width:200px" /></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Bethel Chapter of the CT Poetry Society offers its monthly poetry workshops to members and visitors on the 2nd Saturday of every month.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Each person brings an original poem to read aloud and receive feedback on. Poets at every level are invited to participate; you can be from any town in the area. Poems can be on any subject in any form. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Please register in advance and bring 6 copies of your poem. Our group is welcoming and congenial, emphasizing appreciation of each other's work combined with constructive suggestions   </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:16px">For further information, contact Michael Garry, president, Bethel Chapter of CPS at mgarry1955@gmail.com.  </span></span></p>

        <DIV class="one_event">
        	<a name="7317312"></a>
            
			
            
            
        	
            <DIV class="event_name" style="color:blue">
            	Morning Book Chat
            	
            	
            </DIV>
			
			
                <DIV class="event_time">
                    10:15 AM - 11:30 AM
                </DIV>
            
                        <DIV class="event_description">
                            <p><img alt="" src="https://bethellibraryct.files.wordpress.com/2023/07/demon-copperfield.jpg" style="height:378px; width:250px" /></p>

<p><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px">This month's selection is </span><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif"><em>Demon Copperhead</em></span></span><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:16px"> by Barbara Kingsolver. </span><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">Set in the mountains of southern Appalachia, this is the story of a boy born to a teenaged single mother in a single-wide trailer, with no assets beyond his dead father's good looks and copper-colored hair, a caustic wit, and a fierce talent for survival.  In a plot that never pauses for breath, relayed in his own unsparing voice, he braves the modern perils of foster care, child labor, derelict schools, athletic success, addiction, disastrous loves, and crushing losses.  <em>Demon Copperhead</em> speaks for a new generation of lost boys, and all those born into beautiful, cursed places they can't imagine leaving behind.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">HOW TO GET A COPY:  Please <a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=demon%20copperfield;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BKingsolver%2C%20Barbara%5D"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong><u>click here</u></strong></span></a><a href="https://bethel.biblio.org/eg/opac/results?query=the%20midnight%20library;qtype=keyword;locg=1;detail_record_view=1;sort=poprel;facet=author%7Cpersonal%5BHaig%2C%20Matt%201975-%5D"> </a>to make an online request with your Library card; or call us at <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 255)"><strong>203-794-8756</strong> </span>to check availability of pre-ordered copies at the Circulation Desk.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px"><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif">We are also offering a book guide for all registrants which highlights the authors background, offers book interviews and insights, as well as topics and questions to stimulate the conversation.</span></span></p>

                        </DIV>
                    
                        
                        <DIV class="event_contact">
                        	
								CONTACT:&nbsp;&nbsp;Adult Services Department&nbsp;&nbsp;203-794-8756 ext. 3&nbsp;&nbsp;<A href="mailto:adult@bethellibrary.org">adult@bethellibrary.org</A>
							
                        </DIV>
                    
                    <DIV class="event_location">
                        LOCATION: Morse
                    </DIV>
